captions.text:
From the Wachowski Brothers, err-- siblings
comes the mind-blowing sci-fi game-changer

and the two sequels that took a huge steaming
dump on it.

Prepare for the most original sci-fi franchise
since Star Wars

that ultimately went all Jar Jar Binks on
itself.

Relive all the awesome moments you loved from
the first film.
That one sequence you liked from the second.
And absolutely nothing from the third.

Jack in to The Matrix, a virtual reality simulation
of the late 90’s, full of flip phones
Outfits straight out of a Marilyn Manson video.

Watch as one hacker named Neo, which is an
anagram for one, becomes “The One” who
can only make one facial expression.
Meet Trinity, the love of Neo’s life

and Morpheus, the...other love of Neo’s
life.

"What you know you can't explain, but you
feel it. It is this feeling that has brought

"You are the one, Neo. I've spent my entire
life looking for you."
"Try and relax. This will feel a little weird."

Together, they’ll face off against Agent
Smith, a villain so cool...

they just copied him a bunch of times instead
of coming up with another cool bad guy.

Watch as these two battle in this awesomely
choreographed kung-fu fight
And then in this Dragonball Z ripoff.

Journey to the Matrix, a world of limitless
possibilities, that had audiences questioning

And then journey to Zion, a world of...sweaty
cave ravers? Really?

We’re gonna spend half of this trilogy here?
Ugh, can we just watch some bullet time again?

So settle in for a film that spawned a thousand
imitators...

And prepare for the thinking man’s action
franchise, that got stuck way too far up it’s
own ass by the end of part two.

“While this answer functioned, it was obviously
fundamentally flawed, thus creating the otherwise

contradictory systemic anomaly, that, if left
unchecked, might threaten the system itself.

I have no idea what he's talking about. Is
it too late for me to take the blue pill?

You know its a bad sign when your video game
and direct-to-DVD cartoon are better than

Click on the box to the left for the Screen
Junkies Show One Year Extravaganza featuring

comments.text:
I arrived to matrix way late(just finished the trilogy a few months ago) 
and i dont like the sequels as much
1 is amazing
2 is good but i hated the whole party scene. Seemed useless
3 was boring to me in a way. They werent in the matrix as much as in 1 or 2

I will say though, the action was great in all films. the clone fight in 
part 2 did look fake but i enjoyed it and i loved the last showdown in part 
3.﻿

wagon thing.﻿
